actions.title: CreateBatch
actions.description: Get hundreds or thousands of screenshots from a text file. You can use this API call or the dashboard. Unlike the other API calls, you must issue a POST request with the Content-Type "multipart/form-data" in order to upload the text file. The text file must contain the list of URLs to request, 1 URL per line. Failed screenshots will be tried up to 3 times before giving up.

delay.description: number of seconds to wait after the page has loaded. This is used to let JavaScript run longer before taking the screenshot. Use delay=0 to take screenshots faster.

flash_delay.description: number of seconds to wait after the page has loaded if Flash elements are present. Use flash_delay=0 to take screenshots faster.

screen_width.description: width of the browser window. For desktop browsers only.

screen_height.description: height of the browser window. For desktop browsers only. (Note: full-page screenshots can have a height of up to 15,000px)

priority.description: assign priority to the screenshot (for private instances only)

referer.description: use a custom referrer header - paid screenshots only

post_data.description: send a POST requests with post_data, useful for filling out forms - paid screenshots only

cookie.description: set a cookie for the URL requested (see Custom POST Data, Referer and Cookie) Cookies should be separated by a ; - paid screenshots only

script.description: URL of javascript file to execute after the page load event

details.description: level of information available with screenshot/info

html.description: saves the HTML of the rendered page which can be retrieved by the API call screenshot/html. This feature costs *1 credit* per screenshot.

max_wait.description: maximum number of seconds to wait before triggering the PageLoad event. Note that delay will still be used. (default: 0 = disabled)

headers.description: any custom HTTP headers. (Not supported with Internet Explorer)

hosting_height.description: maximum height of the thumbnail to host

hosting_width.description: maximum height of the thumbnail to host

hosting_scale.description: scale of the thumbnail to host

hosting_bucket.description: S3 bucket to upload the screenshot or thumbnail (required for S3)

hosting_file.description: file name to use (for S3 only)

hosting_headers.description: list of headers to add to the S3 object (for S3 only)

Screenshots requests to private and shared instances require a positive balance.

actions.title: DeleteScreenshot
actions.description: You can delete details of your screenshots to remove any confidential information.

data.description: data to remove. You can specify multiple of them (separated by a ,): *image* (image files), *url* (url requested), *metadata* (time added, time finished, post data, cookie and referer used for the screenshot), *all* (all data and files)

actions.title: CreateMultipleScreenshots
actions.description:
Request multiple screenshots in one API call. The API call accepts all the parameters supported by screenshot/create.
You can specify up to 10 URLs and 10 instances for a total of 100 screenshots in one API call.

actions.title: ShareScreenshot
actions.description: You can make your screenshots public, add notes, and share it with your friends and colleagues. Only screenshots which are successfully completed can be shared.n the thumbnail. You can take a 1024x768 screenshot, crop it to 768x768, and get it scaled down to 300x300.

note.description: note to add on the sharing page

actions.title: GetThumbnail
actions.description:
Unlike the other API calls, this API sends back the thumbnail as a PNG file, not JSON. The HTTP response code indicates whether the screenshot was successful (200), or incomplete (404) or failed (404). If the screenshot failed or is not finished, a default image "Not found" is sent.

You can crop your screenshots. The crop is done first, then the thumbnail. You can take a 1024x768 screenshot, crop it to 768x768, and get it scaled down to 300x300.

ratio.description: Use fit to keep the original page ration, and fill to get a thumbnail for the exact width and height.  specified. If you provide both width and height, you need to specify the ratio: fit to keep the original width/height ratio (the thumbnail might be smaller than the specified width and height), or fill to crop the image if necessary.

left.description: left edge of the area to be cropped

right.description: right edge of the area to be cropped

top.description: top edge of the area to be cropped

bottom.description: bottom edge of the area to be cropped

shot.description: get the second or third screenshot if multiple screenshots were requested

quality.description: JPEG quality factor (for JPEG thumbnails only)
